verses.verse: "Where<WH575> has your beloved<WH1730> gone,<WH1980> O most beautiful<WH3303> among women<WH802>? Where<WH575> has your beloved<WH1730> turned,<WH6437> That we may seek<WH1245> him with you?"

"My beloved<WH1730> has gone<WH3381> down<WH3381> to his garden,<WH1588> To the beds<WH6170> of balsam,<WH1314> To pasture<WH7462> [his flock] in the gardens<WH1588> And gather<WH3950> lilies.<WH7799>
"I am my beloved<WH1730>'s and my beloved is mine, He who pastures<WH7462> [his flock] among the lilies.<WH7799>"
"You are as beautiful<WH3303> as Tirzah,<WH8656> my darling,<WH7474> As lovely<WH5000> as Jerusalem,<WH3389> As awesome<WH366> as an army<WH1713> with banners.<WH1713>
"Turn<WH5437> your eyes<WH5869> away<WH5437> from me, For they have confused<WH7292> me; Your hair<WH8181> is like a flock<WH5739> of goats<WH5795> That have descended<WH1570> from Gilead.<WH1568>

"Your teeth<WH8127> are like a flock<WH5739> of ewes<WH7353> Which<WH7945> have come<WH5927> up from [their] washing,<WH7367> All<WH3605> of which<WH7945> bear<WH8382> twins,<WH8382> And not one<WH369> among them has lost<WH9599> her young.<WH9599>
"Your temples<WH7541> are like a slice<WH6400> of a pomegranate<WH7416> Behind<WH4480> <WH1157> your veil.<WH6777>
"There<WH1992> are sixty<WH8346> queens<WH4436> and eighty<WH8084> concubines,<WH6370> And maidens<WH5959> without<WH369> number;<WH4557>

[But] my dove,<WH3123> my perfect<WH8535> one,<WH8535> is unique:<WH259> She is her mother's only<WH259> [daughter;] She is the pure<WH1249> [child] of the one who bore<WH3205> her. The maidens<WH1323> saw<WH7200> her and called<WH833> her blessed,<WH833> The queens<WH4436> and the concubines<WH6370> [also,] and they praised<WH1984> her, [saying,]

'Who<WH4310> is this<WH384> that grows<WH8259> like<WH3644> the dawn,<WH7837> As beautiful<WH3303> as the full<WH3842> moon,<WH3842> As pure<WH1249> as the sun,<WH2535> As awesome<WH366> as an army<WH1713> with banners<WH1713>?'

"I went<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the orchard<WH1593> of nut<WH93> trees<WH93> To see<WH7200> the blossoms of the valley,<WH3> To see<WH5158> whether the vine<WH7200> had budded<WH1612> [Or] the pomegranates<WH6524> had bloomed.<WH7416>
"Before I was aware,<WH3045> my soul<WH5315> set<WH7760> me [Over] the chariots<WH4818> of my noble<WH5081> people.<WH5971>"

"Come<WH7725> back,<WH7725> come<WH7725> back,<WH7725> O Shulammite;<WH7759> Come<WH7725> back,<WH7725> come<WH7725> back,<WH7725> that we may gaze<WH2372> at you!" "Why<WH4100> should you gaze<WH2372> at the Shulammite,<WH7759> As at the dance<WH4246> of the two companies<WH4264>?
